metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4379 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in __nfs42_ssc_open() infs/nfs/nfs4file.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows an attacker toconduct a remote denial

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4379` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 6.1.0-14.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-14.14').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
